statutoryBodies.name: Sri Lanka Nurses' Council
statutoryBodies.statusNote: Established by Section 2. Body corporate with perpetual succession, common seal, and legal capacity to sue and be sued. Repealed Part IX of the Medical Ordinance (Chapter 105) which previously governed nurse registration. The Council is the sole regulatory body for the nursing profession in Sri Lanka.

elected.note: Elected from among registered nurses with minimum 12 years' experience; eligible for re-election (S.3)

nominated.note: Representatives from staff nursing, finance, higher education, teaching hospitals, and private sector; 5-year term; eligible for re-nomination (S.3)

meetings.chairperson: President (elected from among elected members; S.7)
meetings.dissentMechanism: Majority voting; presiding officer has casting vote (S.9)

powers: Register qualified nurses and maintain the nursing register (S.11(a), S.16)
Suspend, remove, or restore nurses from the register (S.11(c), S.20)
Recommend conditions of recruitment for nurses (S.11(d))
Prescribe code of ethics for the nursing profession (S.11(i))
Delegate powers to committees of at least 5 members (S.12)
dataGaps: No publicly available meeting records or minutes

timeline.event: Sri Lanka Nurses' Council Act enacted
timeline.details: Enacted as Act No. 19 of 1988. Establishes the Sri Lanka Nurses' Council as a body corporate to regulate the nursing profession. Repeals Part IX of the Medical Ordinance (Chapter 105) which previously governed nurse registration. Creates the Sri Lanka Nurses' Fund from registration fees.
The Sri Lanka Nurses' Council was constituted under Section 2 on the date appointed by the Minister via Gazette notification. 17-member body corporate with perpetual succession.

tiers.name: Minister
tiers.relationship: Policy authority: makes regulations (S.26), nominates 5 Council members (S.3), may remove nominated members (S.6), determines member remuneration (S.13), hears appeals against Council decisions (S.15)

tiers.name: Sri Lanka Nurses' Council
tiers.relationship: Regulatory body corporate (S.2): 17 members (5 ex-officio + 7 elected + 5 nominated); registers nurses (S.16), disciplines registrants (S.20), recommends curricula (S.11(e)), inspects nursing institutions (S.11(h)), prescribes code of ethics (S.11(i))

tiers.name: Registrar
tiers.relationship: Appointed by Council (S.14); serves as Secretary and Treasurer; maintains the nursing register (S.16), issues certificates (S.21), administers Sri Lanka Nurses' Fund (S.22)

tiers.name: Registered Nurses
tiers.relationship: Must be registered to practise (S.16); minimum age 21; aliens require Presidential approval; subject to disciplinary action for misconduct (S.20); must pay prescribed fees

currentReplacement.national: Sri Lanka Nurses' Council — sole regulatory body for nursing profession; replaced Medical Ordinance Part IX registration system
currentReplacement.provincial: Not applicable — nursing regulation is a national function
